intro: Rinorea hymenosepala, commonly known as the velvetleaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, often waxy leaves that give it a velvety appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Rinorea hymenosepala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
